intro: Cinchona timorana, commonly known as the Timor quinine tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the islands of Timor and the Moluccas in Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are elliptical and have a glossy surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, followed by oval-shaped berries. The bark of Cinchona timorana contains alkaloids, similar to other cinchona species, and has historically been used in traditional medicine.
